## CES-D vs GHQ-30

Making precise comparisons between psychiatric questionnaires like CES-D (Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression) and GHQ-30 (General Health Questionnaire) can be challenging. Both of these instruments are used commonly and we need an effective way to harmonise the interpretation of their results. Harmony, a powerful new software utilising natural language processing and generative AI, offers a transformative solution for CES-D vs GHQ-30 comparisons.


## Compare the items in CES-D English and GHQ-30

## You may also be interested in these harmonisations

* [DUDIT vs ASSIST](/compare-harmonise-instruments/alcoholism/dudit-vs-assist)
* [GHQ 12 vs SDQ](/compare-harmonise-instruments/ghq-12-vs-sdq)


Harmony simplifies the process of harmonising questionnaires by providing a percentage match for items between questionnaires such as CES-D and GHQ-30. Simply select your instruments from Harmony's broad database or upload your own PDF files to Harmony's user-friendly web interface.





For researchers working on CES-D vs GHQ-30 and similar studies, Harmony significantly reduces manual labor and subjectivity in the comparison process, enabling cross-study and intra-study comparisons more efficiently. The CES-D vs GHQ-30 analysis doesn't have to be limited to one language. Harmony supports multiple languages, expanding the scope of comparative studies and contributing to the universality of psychological and sociological research outcomes. When comparing qualitative studies such as CES-D vs GHQ-30, researchers can rely on Harmony to deliver accurate, swift, and objective results. Utilize the power of AI in your research with Harmony, making questionnaire harmonisation a breeze.
